comment.author: 12039507@N06
comment._content: This looks like the outline of the notorious Triumph of Civic Virtue statue, banished from New York's City Hall to the Borough of Queens and most recently sent to Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT July 25, 1914 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0F16F93A5B1373... Plaster cast model for first design displayed, included four American mountain lions as well as a young man representing Jusice, Order, Beauty, and Peace (together comprising "Civic Virtue) NYT Jan 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB091FF63E5B1773... "CITY TURNS DOWN MACMONNIES WORK; Noted Sculptor's Model for City Hall Park Fountain Rejected by Commission. IT WAS BEGUN IN 1907. Not in Harmony with City Hall, Committee Says -- War May Delay New Design." New-York tribune. (New York [N.Y.]), 27 July 1919, Page 12 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1919-07-27/ed-... mentions silhouette of new design with two conquered sirens mounted on site -- presumably the outline in this Bain photo. NYT March 6, 1922 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20C13F734541B7A... Before installation, women's organizations protested that it "degrades womanhood."

comment.author: 12039507@N06
comment._content: Thanks for the great research, swanq!

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It looks like the silhouette display in July, 1919 recounted in the Tribune article followed by several years the event in this picture, which is reproduced in the New Outlook for March 2, 1916. One tipoff, has it ever snowed in late July in New York?: books.google.com/books?id=qjn5anNyVQwC&pg=PA502&d... A photo of the fountain in City Hall Park, along with some amusing quotes about the controversy, in July, 1922 Popular Mechanics. books.google.com/books?id=lDZLAAAAMAAJ&pg=RA1-PA820&a... A detailed history of the statue, at least up to its removal from Queens, is at blog.insidetheapple.net/2011/02/fate-of-frederick-macmonn... An account of the move to Brooklyn in 2012 is at www.green-wood.com/2012/civic-virtue-at-green-wood/

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @artolog:  Good find in New Outlook, which definitely resolves the puzzling 1919 date.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: swanq and artolog: Thanks for the diligent digging to find the story of this model and the statue.  We will expand the record to reflect some of this story.
